chemoreception.notes: Likely used for locating decaying wood in the deep sea environment, given their habitat on sunken timber. Necessary for food source location since they lack an anus/intestine.

mechanoreception.notes: Echinoderms generally possess mechanoreceptors for sensing their environment. Sea daisies would likely use this to detect water currents or physical contact with wood surfaces.

vision.notes: No information available on vision in Xyloplacidae. Given their deep sea habitat, vision is less likely, but cannot be ruled out without further research.
